interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
India is the world's largest democracy, with over 1.3 billion people.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions.
The United States is home to the world's oldest national park, Yellowstone National Park.
The United Kingdom is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
Germany is known for its beer, with over 1,300 breweries producing more than 5,000 different beers.
Italy is home to the largest number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the world.
Spain is known for its siestas, a short nap taken in the early afternoon.
Japan is known for its cherry blossoms, which bloom in the spring and are celebrated with hanami, or flower-viewing parties.
South Korea is known for its K-pop music and Korean dramas, which have gained international popularity.
Mexico is home to the world's largest pyramid, the Great Pyramid of Cholula.
Canada is the second-largest country in the world by area, covering more than 9.9 million square kilometers.
